meanings.sent1: The misapplied paint caused the wall to look messy.
meanings.sent2: The misapplied sticker was peeling off the book cover.
meanings.sent3: The misapplied label on the jar made it seem like a different product.
meanings.sent4: Her misapplied makeup gave her a clown-like appearance.
meanings.sent5: The misapplied glue left a sticky residue on the table.

meanings.definition: Used or applied in a wrong or inappropriate way
meanings.sent1: The misapplied instructions led to a confusing outcome.
meanings.sent2: The misapplied pressure caused the pipe to burst.
meanings.sent3: His misapplied humor in the serious meeting made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misapplied logic in her argument made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent5: The misapplied force caused the fragile object to break.
